text.headline: Electronic invoices timeline
text.text:
A timeline of how electronic invoicing is introduced in Europe. JSON file on https://github.com/ZUGFeRD/core/blob/master/einvoices-history.json for the great MPL Knightlabs Timeline.
v1.4 2021-12-06 by Jochen Stärk, Mustangproject.org

License: Public domain. Feel free to send pull requests. I'm e.g. looking for ZUGFeRD Roadshow dates and FNFE cooperation events.

text.headline: EDI-Standards in Germany
text.text: Andreas Pelekies mentioned on the fourth annual FeRD conference in 2018 that the first EDI standards in Germany evolved in 1977 (https://www.ferd-net.de/upload/Pelekies_Aktueller_Stand_von_ZUGFeRD_2.0_4._FeRD.pdf)

text.headline: ebXML
text.text: UN/CEFACT publishes https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/EbXML, the predecessor of UBL

text.headline: UBL 1.0
text.text: OASIS publishes UBL, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Business_Language

text.headline: Denmark
text.text: Denmark makes electronic B2G invoices (in a UBL based standard called OIOUBL) obligatory and saves 100 mio € per year (https://www.batch.co.uk/web/images/PDFs/EU-report.pdf)

text.headline: UBL 2.0
text.text: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Business_Language 2.0 is released

text.headline: Sweden
text.text: Sweden follows Denmark in mandatorizing eInvoices for central government agencies

text.headline: European legislative process
text.text: European legislation advances from a report of the Expert Group on e-Invoicing (https://www.batch.co.uk/web/images/PDFs/EU-report.pdf) to the Directive 2014/55/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/ALL/?uri=CELEX%3A32014L0055

text.headline: Spain
text.text: Mandatory for Public administration suppliers (invoices higher than EUR 5 000)

text.headline: Finland
text.text: eInvoicing is mandatory through the Finnish Government Programme since 2010

text.headline: FeRD founded
text.text: The Forum elektronische Rechnung Deutschland (FeRD) is founded

text.headline: Release of ZUGFeRD 1.0RC
text.text: In the context of the Cebit fair the 1.0 specification release candidate of ZUGFeRD is released in german language

text.headline: UBL 2.1
text.text: UBL 2.1, the later ISO standard, is released

text.headline: Austria
text.text: B2G e-invoicing becomes mandatory in Austria

text.headline: Italy
text.text: B2G eInvoicing is mandatory since 2014 (https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eInvoicing+in+Italy)

text.headline: Konik 0.1.0
text.text: First release of the Konik open-source Java ZUGFeRD library

text.headline: Mustangproject
text.text: First release of the open-source Java ZUGFeRD library Mustangproject

text.headline: ZUGFeRD 1.0
text.text: Release of final ZUGFeRD 1.0 specification (in german)

text.headline: Article in the german iX Magazine 8/14
text.text: Vadim Bauer from Konik writes https://www.heise.de/ix/heft/Fakturierungsautomat-2268413.html

text.headline: 1st annual FeRD conference
text.text: The FeRD meets at the Ministry of Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy in Berlin

text.headline: Release of ZUGFeRD 1.0.1 specification
text.text: more precisely: Corrigendum to 1.0

text.headline: Mustangproject 1.1
text.text: Mustangproject 1.1 is released

text.headline: Slovenia
text.text: B2G eInvoicing is mandatory in Slovenia since 2015

text.headline: Release of ZUGFeRD 1.0 specification (in english)
text.text: Previously it was available only in german

text.headline: 1st developer days
text.text: The FeRDMC organizes the first ZUGFeRD developer conference in Bielefeld, Germany

text.headline: 2nd developer days
text.text: The FeRDMC organizes the second ZUGFeRD developer conference in Bielefeld, Germany

text.headline: Official Launch of zugferd-community.net
text.text: The FeRDMC launches the website among others for ZUGFeRD developer days participants

text.headline: Mustangproject 1.2
text.text: The open-source Java ZUGFeRD library Mustangproject releases Version 1.2

text.headline: 3rd developer days
text.text: The FeRDMC organizes the third ZUGFeRD developer conference in Bielefeld, Germany

text.headline: UBL becomes ISO Standard
text.text: UBL 2.1 becomes ISO/IEC 19845:2015

text.headline: ZUGFeRD/Mustangproject is awarded the OSBAR
text.text: Mustangproject is awarded the first prize (award in gold) of the Open Source Business Association at the Open! conference in Stuttgart

text.headline: 160 supporters
text.text: The list of supporters counts 160 supporters from 7 countries

text.headline: Mustangproject 1.3
text.text: Mustangpproject releases version 1.3

text.headline: 199 supporters
text.text: http://www.ferd-net.de/zugferd/unterstuetzerliste/index.html counts 199 supporters

text.headline: 4th developer days
text.text: The FeRDMC organizes the fourth ZUGFeRD developer conference in Bielefeld, Germany

text.headline: 3rd annual FeRD conference in Berlin
text.text: The FeRD meets at the Ministry of Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy in Berlin

text.headline: France
text.text:
Gradual introduction of electronic invoicing,
  • 01/01/2017 for any company including more than 5000 employees
  • 01/01/2018 for any company including 250 to 5000 employees
  • 01/01/2019 for any company including 10 to 250 employees
  • 01/01/2020 for any company including less than 10 employees

text.headline: Netherlands
text.text: B2G eInvoicing is mandatory since January 2017 for central government agencies and voluntary for sub-central government. (https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eInvoicing+in+The+Netherlands)

text.headline: Official launch of the ZUGFeRD User Group
text.text: FeRDMC(?) launches a committee to be able to adapt to the electronic invoicing requirements of different industry sectors

text.headline: Estonia
text.text: Electronic invoices become mandatory for the whole public sector

text.headline: Amendment to the german e-invoing act (E-Rechnungsverordnung)
text.text: The amendment is published in Germany's official journal Bundesgesetzblatt 19/2017 https://www.bgbl.de/xaver/bgbl/start.xav?startbk=Bundesanzeiger_BGBl#__bgbl__%2F%2F*%5B%40attr_id%3D%27bgbl117s0770.pdf%27%5D__1516912634862

text.headline: Release of XRechnung 1.0 (Specification)
text.text: XRechnung, the german national dialect, i.e. a EN16931 CIUS, is published https://www.xoev.de/die_standards/xrechnung/xrechnung_versionen/xrechnung_version_1_0-14771

text.headline: Mustangproject 1.4
text.text: The open source java ZUGFeRD library is releases Version 1.4

text.headline: FNFE Publishes Factur-X Beta 1
text.text: The french Forum National de la Factur Electronique publishes ZUGFeRD as Factur-X

text.headline: Lithuania
text.text: B2G eInvoicing is mandatory since 1 July 2017 (https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eInvoicing+in+Lithuania)

text.headline: 1st release of factur-x
text.text: The open-source Python library for ZUGFeRD/Factur-X is released http://www.akretion.com/blog/akretion-publishes-opensource-factur-x-python-lib

text.headline: Public review of ZUGFeRD 2.0,Part 1 (EN16931)
text.text: A ZUGFeRD 2.0 draft is released as public preview version http://www.ferd-net.de/aktuelles/meldungen/kommentierung-zugferd-2.0.html

text.headline: German e-invoing act (E-Rechnungsverordnung)
text.text: (https://www.bmi.bund.de/SharedDocs/Downloads/DE/Gesetzestexte/e-rechnungs-verordnung.pdf)

text.headline: Adoption of EN16931 profile of Public review of ZUGFeRD 2.0,Part 1
text.text: The public preview gets adopted but is not yet officially published

text.headline: FNFE Publishes Factur-X Beta 2
text.text: The french Forum National de la Factur Electronique publishes the second beta of ZUGFeRD/Factur-X

text.headline: Change E-Rechnungsverordnung act Bundesgesetzblatt 68/2017
text.text: Amendment to the e-invoicing act (E-Rechnungsverordnung) is published in Germany's official journal Bundesgesetzblatt 68/2017

text.headline: German E-Rechnungsverordnung Phase 1
text.text: electronic invoices to be accepted by german authorities

text.headline: 308 officially listed ZUGFeRD supporters
text.text: http://www.ferd-net.de/zugferd/unterstuetzerliste/index.html

text.headline: Mustangproject 1.5
text.text: Mustangproject releases version 1.5

text.headline: FNFE Publishes Factur-X 1.0
text.text: The french Forum National de la Factur Electronique publishes the final version of a ZUGFeRD 2.0 subset = Factur-X 1.0

text.headline: 4th annual FeRD conference in Berlin
text.text: See slides and footage

text.headline: European transition period for central govermental bodies
text.text: according to https://www.ferd-net.de/upload/Hauschild_Europische_Richtlinie_zur_elektronischen_Rechnungsstellung_bei_ffentlichen_Auftrgen_4._FeRD_Konferenz.pdf

text.headline: Transition period for subcentral govermental bodies
text.text: according to https://www.ferd-net.de/upload/Hauschild_Europische_Richtlinie_zur_elektronischen_Rechnungsstellung_bei_ffentlichen_Auftrgen_4._FeRD_Konferenz.pdf

text.headline: Belgium
text.text: E-invoices mandatory on federal level for B2G invoices exceeding 135000€

text.headline: Mustangproject published the 2nd article in the german iX Magazine 4/18
text.text: B2G, B2B and B2C aspects of ZUGFeRD 2.0 and XRechnung

text.headline: 6th ZUGFeRD Developer Days
text.text: The FeRDMC organizes the sixth ZUGFeRD developer conference in Bielefeld, Germany

text.headline: New online validator
text.text: https://github.com/ZUGFeRD/ZUV/ becomes available in version 0.4.4 as http://validator.zugferd.org

text.headline: Germany: B2G e-invoices now mandatory
text.text: E-Rechnungsverordnung Phase 2: paper and non-hybrid PDF invoices to be rejected by german authorities

text.headline: ZUGFeRD 2 EN16931 profile public preview
text.text: Public preview (http://web.archive.org/web/20180409215558/http://www.ferd-net.de:80/aktuelles/meldungen/kommentierung-zugferd-2.0.html) and approval (https://www.ferd-net.de/aktuelles/meldungen/verabschiedung-zugferd-2.0_profil-en16931.html) of the EN16931 profile of ZUGFeRD 2.0

text.headline: ZUGFeRD 2 public preview
text.text: Public preview (https://www.ferd-net.de/aktuelles/meldungen/entwurf-der-spezifikation-zugferd-2.0-zur-oeffentlichen-kommentierung.html) of ZUGFeRD 2.0

text.headline: New online validator version
text.text: https://github.com/ZUGFeRD/ZUV/ becomes available in version 0.5.0

text.headline: Release of XRechnung 1.1 (Specification)
text.text: A new version of XRechnung, the german national dialect, i.e. a EN16931 CIUS, is published

text.headline: Germany launches National Invoicing Platform (Zentralen Rechnungseingangsplattform)
text.text: https://www.bmi.bund.de/DE/themen/moderne-verwaltung/verwaltungsmodernisierung/e-beschaffung/e-beschaffung-artikel.html

text.headline: EU commision and CEN agree to make 16931-1:2017 and 16931-2:2017 available for free
text.text: (german) https://www.zugferd-community.net/infothek/kostenloser_zugang_zum_semantischen_datenmodell_und_den_syntaxen_des_europaeischen_standards_fuer_einvoicing_en_16931_vereinbart

text.headline: 1st Factur-X Hackathon
text.text: The FNFE organizes the first Factur-X developer conference in Paris, France

text.headline: Mustangproject 1.6
text.text: Mustangproject releases version 1.6 supporting Factur-X

text.headline: ZUGFeRD 2.0
text.text: Release of the final ZUGFeRD 2.0 specification (in german)

text.headline: Mustangproject 1.7
text.text: Mustangproject releases version 1.7 supporting ZUGFeRD 2.0

text.headline: New online validator version 0.7
text.text: https://github.com/ZUGFeRD/ZUV/ becomes available in version 0.7.0 supporting ZUGFeRD 2.0

text.headline: New online validator version 0.8
text.text: https://github.com/ZUGFeRD/ZUV/ 0.8.0 introduces schema checks (not only schematron)

text.headline: 7th developer days
text.text: The FeRDMC organizes the seventh ZUGFeRD developer conference (ZUGFeRD-Entwicklertage) in Bielefeld, Germany

text.headline: ZUGFeRD 2.0.1
text.text: Release of the ZUGFeRD 2.0.1 correction (in german)

text.headline: Release of XRechnung 1.2 (Specification)
text.text: A new version of XRechnung, the german national dialect, i.e. a EN16931 CIUS, is published

text.headline: Franco-German conference on digitalisation
text.text: https://www.bundesregierung.de/breg-en/service/driving-digitalisation-forward-in-europe-485574

text.headline: ZUGFeRD 2.1, Factur-X 1.0.05
text.text: The french Forum National de la Factur Electronique publishes the final version of Factur-X 1.0.05 simulaneously to the german AWV publishing ZUGFeRD 2.1 (in german and english)

text.headline: New version of online validator
text.text: https://github.com/ZUGFeRD/ZUV/ becomes available in version 0.9.0 supporting Factur-X 1.0.05 and ZUGFeRD 2.1

text.headline: Release of XRechnung 2.0 (Specification)
text.text: A new version of XRechnung, the german national dialect, i.e. a EN16931 CIUS, is published, with a two profiles: standard and extensions

text.headline: Mandatory B2B e-invoicing in Italy
text.text: Italy becomes the first european nation to introduce mandatory B2B e-invoicing.

text.headline: 8th developer days
text.text: The FeRDMC organizes the seventh ZUGFeRD developer conference (ZUGFeRD-Entwicklertage), due to Corona online

text.headline: France publishes intention to make B2B e-invoicing mandatory
text.text: Pending EU permission, France wants to introduce mandatory B2B e-invoicing between 2023 and 2025.

text.headline: Order-X 1.0
text.text: Order-X 1.0 is published in german, english and french.

text.headline: Mustangproject 2.0
text.text: Mustangproject releases version 2.0 integrating the validator, supporting a invoice class instead of only an interface, Maven Central and ZUGFeRD 2.1

text.headline: Mustangproject 2.1
text.text: Mustangproject releases version 2.1 supporting ZUGFeRD 2.1.1

text.headline: Mustangproject 2.2
text.text: Mustangproject releases version 2.2 capable of validating Order-X

text.headline: Mustangproject 2.3
text.text: Mustangproject releases version 2.3 capable of validating XR 2.1

text.headline: Gemeinsame Erklärung (Common Statement)
text.text: The German Minstry for Interior publishes a statement that it will partner up with the Ministry of Economy in terms of ZUGFeRD

text.headline: France's plans to introduce mandatory B2B-e-invoicing
text.text: Apparently, France is set to introduce mandatory B2B-e-invoicing in 2025

text.headline: Study on mandatory B2B-e-Invoicing in Germany
text.text: The VER released a study if mandatory B2B-e-invoicing could and should be introduced in Germany

text.headline: Report on VAT fraud by the German Federal Audit Office
text.text: The German Federal Audit Office requested solutions to VAT fraud

text.headline: Report by the Bundestag's research service
text.text: The research service of the Bundestag publishes what needed to be done in order to introduce mandatory B2B-e-invoicing

text.headline: Request by a political party
text.text: The liberals de facto request the introduction of mandatory B2B e-invoices

text.headline: Preparations for B2B e-invoice obligations enter the german coalition agreement
text.text: A federal reporting system on VAT which will be used for the creation, validation and forwarding of invoices is to be created.

text.headline: The French Presidency’s ministerial conference on e-invoicing: Electronic invoicing: an instrument for the digital transformation of businesses & government
text.text: <iframe width='560' height='315' src='https://www.youtube-nocookie.com/embed/G28pmP2tRIU' title='YouTube video player' frameborder='0' allow='accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture' allowfullscreen></iframe>

text.headline: XBestellung 1.0
text.text: Release of a UBL based proposal for german B2G (or rather G2B) orders on the newly launched XEinkauf (XProcurement) homepage

text.headline: Germany requests exemption as per Art. 395 MwStSystRL
text.text: As mentioned here, Germany requested in November 2022 from the EU to be allowed to introduce B2B e-invoicing

text.headline: French event 'Journée de la Facture Électronique 2023'
text.text: <iframe width='560' height='315' src='https://www.youtube-nocookie.com/embed/0ncZ-4BENRU' title='YouTube video player' frameborder='0' allow='accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture' allowfullscreen></iframe>

text.headline: Germany starts discussion on a potential B2B e-invoicing introduction as per 2025
text.text: As mentioned here, the german government requests feedback from stakeholders on a potential introduction of mandatory domestic B2B e-invoicing as of 01.01.2025

text.headline: Mustangproject 2.4
text.text: Mustangproject releases version 2.4 capable of writing Order-X

text.headline: Mustangproject 2.5
text.text: Mustangproject releases version 2.5 upgrading to zf 2.2, 2.5.1+: 1Lieferschein, xr 2.2

text.headline: Mustangproject 2.6
text.text: Mustangproject releases version 2.6 with Factur-X improvements and automated server tests

text.headline: Mustangproject 2.7
text.text: Mustangproject releases version 2.7 with english and french output and UBL input in factur-x visualization

text.headline: Deliver-X Kickoff
text.text: Official start of work on Deliver-X standardization

text.headline: Draft law on mandatory domestic B2B e-invoices in Germany
text.text: The EU has allowed Germany to introduce B2B e-invoices and the german government has approved the according legal act (changing it's deadline from 2025 to 2026) so the draft for the Wachstumschancengesetz, which will change the VAT law, is now a 'governmental draft', i.e. a Regierungsentwurf (pg 65, 66 and 243 refer to VAT).(background)

text.headline: Mustangproject 2.8
text.text: Mustangproject releases version 2.8 with first UBL read support

text.headline: CWA 16356
text.text: The work of the CEN's CWA 16356 (Message User Group, MUG) later served as the basis for EN16931

text.headline: French National E-Invoice Day 2023
text.text: <iframe width='560' height='315' src='https://www.youtube-nocookie.com/embed/0ncZ-4BENRU' title='YouTube video player' frameborder='0' allow='accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture' allowfullscreen></iframe>

text.headline: French National E-Invoice Day 2024
text.text: Videos and slides are on the FNFE homepage

text.headline: Germany adopts statutory domestic B2B-e-invoicing
text.text: The german Federal Council (Bundesrat) passed the law on statutory domestic B2B e-invoicing which will ban paper and PDF invoices without Factur-X between german companies in 2028 at the latest (background).

text.headline: Croatia
text.text: B2G eInvoicing is mandatory in Croatia since 2019
